New Records: Sanju Samson scored his maiden T20I hundred in just 40 balls, the second quickest hundred by an Indian in T20Is.
India recorded their highest T20I score of 297/6, the highest T20I score by a Full-Member side.
Ravi Bishnoi became India's youngest bowler to reach 50 T20I wickets.
Key Match Events: Sanju Samson scored a 40-ball hundred, including five consecutive sixes off Rishad Hossain.
Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya contributed quickfire knocks to India's total.
India's bowlers restricted Bangladesh to 164, securing a 133-run victory.
Ravi Bishnoi took three wickets, including the pivotal wickets of Litton Das and Najmul Shanto.
Mahmudullah played his final T20I match, ending his career as Bangladesh's most capped T20I player.
Pre-Game Insights: India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate backed Sanju Samson's aggressive intent as an opener.
Bangladesh's assistant coach Nic Pothas attributed the team's poor six-hitting record to genetics, highlighting the strength and conditioning differences between Indian and Bangladeshi players.
Post-Match Reflections: Ravi Bishnoi expressed his satisfaction with reaching the milestone of 50 T20I wickets and emphasized the importance of healthy competition within the team.
Mahmudullah expressed disappointment in his final T20I match as Bangladesh struggled throughout the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad was a mix of red and black soil, providing assistance to bowlers despite being a high-scoring venue.
There was a slight drizzle before the match, but it cleared up in time for the game to start on schedule.
